28#define UUID_LEN 36
29#define DUID_TIME_EPOCH 946684800
30#define DUID_LLT 1
31#define DUID_LL 3
32#define DUID_UUID 4
33
34#include <sys/param.h>
35#include <sys/socket.h>
36#include <sys/types.h>
37#ifdef BSD
38# include <sys/sysctl.h>
39#endif
40
41#include <arpa/inet.h>
42
43#include <net/if.h>
44#include <net/if_arp.h>
45
46#include <errno.h>
47#include <stdint.h>
48#include <stdio.h>
49#include <stdlib.h>
50#include <string.h>
51#include <time.h>
52#include <unistd.h>
53
54#ifndef ARPHRD_NETROM
55# define ARPHRD_NETROM 0
56#endif
57
58#include "common.h"
59#include "dhcpcd.h"
60#include "duid.h"
61#include "logerr.h"
62
63static size_t
64duid_machineuuid(char *uuid, size_t uuid_len)
65{
66 int r;
67 size_t len = uuid_len;
68
69#if defined(HW_UUID) /* OpenBSD */
70 int mib[] = { CTL_HW, HW_UUID };
71
72 r = sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib)/sizeof(mib[0]), uuid, &len, NULL, 0);
73#elif defined(KERN_HOSTUUID) /* FreeBSD */
74 int mib[] = { CTL_KERN, KERN_HOSTUUID };
75
76 r = sysctl(mib, sizeof(mib)/sizeof(mib[0]), uuid, &len, NULL, 0);
77#elif defined(__NetBSD__)
78 r = sysctlbyname("machdep.dmi.system-uuid", uuid, &len, NULL, 0);
79#elif defined(__linux__)
80 FILE *fp;
81
82 fp = fopen("/sys/class/dmi/id/product_uuid", "r");
83 if (fp == NULL)
84 return 0;
85 if (fgets(uuid, (int)uuid_len, fp) == NULL) {
86 fclose(fp);
87 return 0;
88 }
89 len = strlen(uuid) + 1;
90 fclose(fp);
91 r = len == 1 ? -1 : 0;
92#else
93 UNUSED(uuid);
94 r = -1;
95 errno = ENOSYS;
96#endif
97
98 if (r == -1)
99 return 0;
100 return len;
101}
102
103static size_t
104duid_make_uuid(uint8_t *d)
105{
106 uint16_t type = htons(DUID_UUID);
107 char uuid[UUID_LEN + 1];
108 size_t l;
109
110 if (duid_machineuuid(uuid, sizeof(uuid)) != sizeof(uuid))
111 return 0;
112
113 /* All zeros UUID is not valid */
114 if (strcmp("00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000", uuid) == 0)
115 return 0;
116
117 memcpy(d, &type, sizeof(type));
118 l = sizeof(type);
119 d += sizeof(type);
120 l += hwaddr_aton(d, uuid);
121 return l;
122}
123
124static size_t
125duid_make(uint8_t *d, const struct interface *ifp, uint16_t type)
126{
127 uint8_t *p;
128 uint16_t u16;
129 time_t t;
130 uint32_t u32;
131
132 p = d;
133 u16 = htons(type);
134 memcpy(p, &u16, 2);
135 p += 2;
136 u16 = htons(ifp->family);
137 memcpy(p, &u16, 2);
138 p += 2;
139 if (type == DUID_LLT) {
140 /* time returns seconds from jan 1 1970, but DUID-LLT is
141 * seconds from jan 1 2000 modulo 2^32 */
142 t = time(NULL) - DUID_TIME_EPOCH;
143 u32 = htonl((uint32_t)t & 0xffffffff);
144 memcpy(p, &u32, 4);
145 p += 4;
146 }
147 /* Finally, add the MAC address of the interface */
148 memcpy(p, ifp->hwaddr, ifp->hwlen);
149 p += ifp->hwlen;
150 return (size_t)(p - d);
151}
152
153#define DUID_STRLEN DUID_LEN * 3
154static size_t
155duid_get(uint8_t **d, const struct interface *ifp)
156{
157 FILE *fp;
158 uint8_t *data;
159 size_t len;
160 int x = 0;
161 char line[DUID_STRLEN];
162 const struct interface *ifp2;
163
164 /* If we already have a DUID then use it as it's never supposed
165 * to change once we have one even if the interfaces do */
166 if ((len = read_hwaddr_aton(&data, DUID)) != 0) {
167 if (len <= DUID_LEN) {
168 *d = data;
169 return len;
170 }
171 logerrx("DUID too big (max %u): %s", DUID_LEN, DUID);
172 /* Keep the buffer, will assign below. */
173 } else {
174 if (errno != ENOENT)
175 logerr("%s", DUID);
176 if ((data = malloc(DUID_LEN)) == NULL) {
177 logerr(__func__);
178 return 0;
179 }
180 }
181
182 /* Regardless of what happens we will create a DUID to use. */
183 *d = data;
184
185 /* No file? OK, lets make one based the machines UUID */
186 len = duid_make_uuid(data);
187 if (len > 0)
188 return len;
189
190 /* No UUID? OK, lets make one based on our interface */
191 if (ifp->family == ARPHRD_NETROM) {
192 logwarnx("%s: is a NET/ROM pseudo interface", ifp->name);
193 TAILQ_FOREACH(ifp2, ifp->ctx->ifaces, next) {
194 if (ifp2->family != ARPHRD_NETROM)
195 break;
196 }
197 if (ifp2) {
198 ifp = ifp2;
199 logwarnx("picked interface %s to generate a DUID",
200 ifp->name);
201 } else {
202 logwarnx("no interfaces have a fixed hardware "
203 "address");
204 return duid_make(data, ifp, DUID_LL);
205 }
206 }
207
208 if (!(fp = fopen(DUID, "w"))) {
209 logerr("%s", DUID);
210 return duid_make(data, ifp, DUID_LL);
211 }
212 len = duid_make(data, ifp, DUID_LLT);
213 x = fprintf(fp, "%s\n", hwaddr_ntoa(data, len, line, sizeof(line)));
214 if (fclose(fp) == EOF)
215 x = -1;
216 /* Failed to write the duid? scrub it, we cannot use it */
217 if (x < 1) {
218 logerr("%s", DUID);
219 unlink(DUID);
220 return duid_make(data, ifp, DUID_LL);
221 }
222 return len;
223}
224
225size_t duid_init(const struct interface *ifp)
226{
227
228 if (ifp->ctx->duid == NULL)
229 ifp->ctx->duid_len = duid_get(&ifp->ctx->duid, ifp);
230 return ifp->ctx->duid_len;
231}
